intro: Madia nutans, commonly known as the nodding madia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its nodding, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Madia nutans is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
